*[Bug 18668] ImageMagick missing heic driver (libheif)*
<https://bugs.r-project.org/show_bug.cgi?id=18668>

Tomas Kalibera (<mailto:tomas.kalibera@gmail.com|tomas.kalibera@gmail.com>) changed:

           What    |Removed                     |Added
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
         Resolution|---                         |FIXED
             Status|UNCONFIRMED                 |CLOSED

--- Comment #1 from Tomas Kalibera (<mailto:tomas.kalibera@gmail.com|tomas.kalibera@gmail.com>) ---
I've added heic support to imagemagick in Rtools (to become Rtools45). The
pkg-config package name for R package magick is Magick++.

OK thank you, I submitted a new version of 'pdftools' to CRAN which should use

*[Bug 18842] graphics::filled.contour() doesn't respect the "col" argument*
<https://bugs.r-project.org/show_bug.cgi?id=18842>

--- Comment #2 from Andrey Anikin (<mailto:andrey.anikin@lucs.lu.se|andrey.anikin@lucs.lu.se>) ---
These are all valid points, Paul! I don’t know how filled.contour is typically
used at a low level, with actual colors and/or levels set by the user. It is
certainly safer to extend the documentation, add checks, and raise warnings
than to change the default behavior, particularly since it’s easy enough for a
package developer to make a customized patched version if needed. I can only
say that it took me a while to figure out what was going on as filled.contour
occasionally produced strange artifacts in my spectrograms without any warning
messages. 

As for the proposed patch, my reasoning is that `col` and `levels` are
lower-level parameters, so, as a user, I would intuitively expect them to
override the higher-level `nlevels`, so there could be a cascade of checks like
`if (!missing(col)) {if (!missing(levels) {...}}`, etc. But this would need to
be thought through carefully - as I said, I totally understand that it’s
probably best not to change the default behavior, but simply to document it
more extensively and to add a couple of checks.
